lines.text: ...If we could establish times of death, we could figure something out.
That fire only got big enough to trip the alarm... 25 minutes after the gunshot.
Which is kind of a long time, honestly.
If the hay got set on fire directly, before the gunshot, it shouldn't have taken that long...
So we can probably conclude the fire was set <c=#FF00FF>after the gunshot.</c>
Unless it was some sort of slow-burning thing that only reached the hay later.
And... it's not that useful anyway, since any of them could've started the fire.
Well, it's progress, sorta. Keep it up.
